ü•ï Vegetables.name: asparagus
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate upright in a jar with water, loosely covered.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Asparagus is a spring vegetable known for its tender spears and grassy flavor, often served steamed or grilled.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: avocado
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Avocados are creamy, nutrient-rich fruits used in salads, spreads, and dips like guacamole.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: beet
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a breathable bag with tops trimmed.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Beets are earthy-tasting root vegetables commonly used in salads, juices, and roasted dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: bell pepper
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in the refrigerator crisper drawer.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Bell peppers are sweet, crunchy vegetables available in various colors and used raw or cooked in many dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: green bell pepper
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store unwashed in the fridge crisper drawer; use within 5‚Äì7 days.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Green bell peppers are unripe versions of red/yellow peppers with a firmer texture and slightly bitter flavor, often used in stir-fries, salads, and savory dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: red bell pepper
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in the fridge crisper drawer. Use within 5 days.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Red bell peppers are ripe, sweet peppers rich in vitamin C and antioxidants. They‚Äôre often roasted or eaten raw in salads, sandwiches, or dips.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: yellow bell pepper
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a plastic bag in the fridge; best within 5 days.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Yellow bell peppers are sweet, juicy, and vibrant, commonly used in raw preparations, fajitas, or roasted vegetable medleys.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: broccoli
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a breathable bag or container.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Broccoli is a cruciferous vegetable with edible green florets and stalks, commonly cooked or eaten raw.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: brussels sprout
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a sealed container in the fridge.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Brussels sprouts are small leafy green buds often roasted or saut√©ed, known for their bold flavor.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: cabbage
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Keep in crisper drawer wrapped or in a bag.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Cabbage is a leafy vegetable with a dense head, used raw in slaws or cooked in soups and saut√©s.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: carrot
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a crisper drawer or container.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Carrots are crunchy, sweet root vegetables widely used raw in salads or cooked in many dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: baby carrots
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a sealed bag or container. Keep dry to avoid spoilage.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Baby carrots are small, often pre-peeled carrots sold for convenience. Some are truly young carrots; others are machine-cut from larger ones. Flavor is mild and slightly sweet.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: cauliflower
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Keep in a perforated bag in the fridge.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Cauliflower is a white, cruciferous vegetable often eaten roasted, steamed, or riced as a grain alternative.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: celery
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Wrap in foil or store in water in the fridge.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Celery is a crunchy, watery vegetable commonly used as a base in soups and stews or eaten raw as a snack.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: corn
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate fresh corn in the husk; frozen/canned corn stores longer.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: One ear of corn yields about 3/4 cup kernels (~120 mL).

ü•ï Vegetables.name: cucumber
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate unpeeled for best freshness.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Cucumbers are cool, watery vegetables used fresh in salads or pickled as a condiment.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: eggplant
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dry place; avoid refrigeration.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Eggplants are spongy, purple vegetables often used in Mediterranean and Asian cuisines.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: frozen peas
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Keep frozen until ready to use; do not refreeze after thawing.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Frozen peas are harvested and flash-frozen to preserve nutrients and flavor. Convenient and versatile in many dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: garlic
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place away from sunlight.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Garlic bulbs consist of multiple cloves and are widely used fresh for their pungent aroma and flavor.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: garlic clove
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dry place. Peeled cloves can be refrigerated for short-term use.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: A garlic clove is a single segment of a garlic bulb and is commonly used fresh in cooking for its pungent flavor.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: green beans
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Keep in a plastic bag in the refrigerator.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Green beans are slender, crunchy pods that are eaten whole, commonly cooked or served in salads.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: jalapeno pepper
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a produce bag or container.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Jalape√±os are moderately hot chili peppers used in salsas, sauces, and as toppings.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: kale
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a bag with a paper towel in the fridge.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Kale is a dark leafy green high in fiber and nutrients, often used in salads or cooked side dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: leek
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Wrap in plastic or store uncut in fridge.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Leeks are mild-flavored alliums with a long white stalk and green leaves, often used in soups and braises.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: lettuce
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Keep dry in a sealed container with paper towel.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Lettuce is a leafy vegetable used primarily in salads and sandwiches, available in several varieties.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: mushrooms
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Keep in paper bag or breathable container in fridge.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Mushrooms are edible fungi used in savory dishes for their umami flavor and meaty texture.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: brown mushrooms
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a paper bag in the refrigerator to absorb moisture and keep fresh.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Brown mushrooms, also called cremini or baby bella, are a variety of Agaricus bisporus with a slightly deeper flavor than white button mushrooms.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: onion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store whole in a cool, dark place.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Onions are a foundational aromatic vegetable used in countless savory dishes around the world.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: yellow onion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark pantry away from potatoes.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Yellow onions are the most common cooking onion, with a balance of pungency and sweetness.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: white onion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from light.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: White onions are sharper in flavor than yellow onions and are often used in Latin cuisine.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: red onion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark pantry away from moisture.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Red onions are often used raw in salads and sandwiches for their color and mild sharpness.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: sweet onion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate for best freshness; use quickly after cutting.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Sweet onions have low sulfur content and a mellow flavor, ideal for raw or lightly cooked dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: green onion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in the fridge wrapped in a damp paper towel or upright in water.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Green onions are slender alliums with white bulbs and long green stalks, used raw or lightly cooked for garnish and flavor.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: scallion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Wrap in paper towel and store in a produce bag in the fridge.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Scallions are a type of immature onion used for their mild flavor and crunchy texture in both raw and cooked dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: spring onion
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in the fridge in a plastic bag or cup of water.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Spring onions have a stronger bulb than green onions but are still mild; they‚Äôre used fresh or grilled whole.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: shallot
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark, dry place like regular onions.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Shallots are a mild allium with a blend of garlic and onion flavor, often used in dressings and delicate sauces.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: peas
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Keep frozen or refrigerated; use quickly if fresh.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Peas are small green legumes eaten fresh or frozen and used in soups, salads, and side dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: potato
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark place away from onions.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Potatoes are starchy tubers used in countless savory dishes, known for their versatility and comfort food status.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: yukon gold potato
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark, well-ventilated place; avoid refrigeration to prevent starch conversion to sugar.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Yukon Gold potatoes are all-purpose potatoes with yellow flesh, known for their buttery flavor and smooth texture, ideal for roasting, mashing, or soups.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: radish
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a produce bag or container.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Radishes are spicy, crunchy root vegetables typically eaten raw or pickled, often added to salads and tacos.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: spinach
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a dry bag or container with paper towel.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Spinach is a leafy green high in iron, fiber, and vitamins, used in salads or cooked dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: squash
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate once cut.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Squash includes many varieties of soft- and hard-skinned gourds, used in both savory and sweet dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: sweet potato
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark, well-ventilated place.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Sweet potatoes are orange-fleshed tubers with a sweet flavor, rich in fiber and vitamin A.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: tomato
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Tomatoes are juicy fruits commonly used as vegetables, key in sauces, salads, and cooked dishes.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: crushed tomatoes
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store unopened cans in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate leftovers in a sealed container for up to 5 days or freeze.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Crushed tomatoes are partially blended canned tomatoes that retain some texture. They're ideal for pasta sauces and stews.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: diced tomatoes
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store unopened cans in a cool, dry place. Once opened, refrigerate in a sealed container for up to 5 days or freeze.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Diced tomatoes are chopped and canned, often with tomato juice. They retain chunks and are perfect for chunkier sauces and soups.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: diced tomatoes with green chilis
aliases: canned diced tomatoes with green chilis
substitutes: diced tomatoes and canned green chilis
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store unopened cans in a cool, dry place. Once opened, refrigerate in a sealed container for up to 5 days or freeze.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: A blend of diced tomatoes and green chilis, often used in Tex-Mex and Southwestern dishes. Popular brand: Rotel.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: turnip
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate after cutting.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Turnips are round, white and purple root vegetables with a mild flavor, used in soups and roasts.

ü•ï Vegetables.name: zucchini
ü•ï Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a bag for best texture and shelf life.
ü•ï Vegetables.notes: Zucchini is a summer squash with mild flavor and high water content, used in savory and baked dishes.

üçé Fruits.name: apple
üçé Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate to extend shelf life.
üçé Fruits.notes: Apples are crisp, sweet to tart fruits widely used fresh or cooked in desserts and savory dishes.

üçé Fruits.name: apricot
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate to prolong freshness.
üçé Fruits.notes: Apricots are small, soft fruits with a sweet-tart flavor, often dried or used fresh.

üçé Fruits.name: banana
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature; refrigerate if very ripe to slow browning.
üçé Fruits.notes: Bananas are sweet tropical fruits with soft flesh, commonly eaten fresh or used in baking.

üçé Fruits.name: blackberries
üçé Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for longer storage.
üçé Fruits.notes: Blackberries are dark, juicy berries with a sweet-tart flavor, popular in desserts and jams.

üçé Fruits.name: blueberries
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated; freeze for longer storage.
üçé Fruits.notes: Blueberries are sweet, nutrient-rich berries widely used fresh or in baked goods.

üçé Fruits.name: cherry
üçé Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for long-term storage.
üçé Fruits.notes: Cherries are small, round stone fruits, sweet or tart, popular fresh or in desserts.

üçé Fruits.name: coconut
üçé Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place; refrigerate shredded or milk products.
üçé Fruits.notes: Coconuts provide versatile meat, water, and milk used in many tropical cuisines.

üçé Fruits.name: cranberries
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated; freeze for longer shelf life.
üçé Fruits.notes: Cranberries are tart berries often used in sauces and dried snacks.

üçé Fruits.name: date
üçé Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place; refrigerate to extend freshness.
üçé Fruits.notes: Dates are sweet, chewy fruits popular in Middle Eastern cuisines and snacks.

üçé Fruits.name: fig
üçé Fruits.storage: Refrigerate fresh figs; store dried figs in a cool, dry place.
üçé Fruits.notes: Figs are sweet fruits eaten fresh or dried, often used in baking and snacks.

üçé Fruits.name: grapes
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated; freeze for longer storage.
üçé Fruits.notes: Grapes are sweet berries eaten fresh or dried as raisins, used in juices and wines.

üçé Fruits.name: grapefruit
üçé Fruits.storage: Store in the refrigerator for best freshness.
üçé Fruits.notes: Grapefruits are large citrus fruits with a tart, slightly bitter flavor.

üçé Fruits.name: kiwi
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated for best shelf life and flavor.
üçé Fruits.notes: Kiwis are small, fuzzy fruits with a tart-sweet flavor and bright green flesh.

üçé Fruits.name: lemon
üçé Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate to extend shelf life.
üçé Fruits.notes: Lemons are bright yellow citrus fruits used for juice, zest, and flavoring.

üçé Fruits.name: lime
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated for best freshness.
üçé Fruits.notes: Limes are small green citrus fruits known for their tart juice and zest.

üçé Fruits.name: mango
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
üçé Fruits.notes: Mangoes are sweet, tropical stone fruits with juicy flesh often used fresh or in beverages.

üçé Fruits.name: melon
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated after cutting to maintain freshness.
üçé Fruits.notes: Melons are sweet, juicy fruits with various varieties like cantaloupe and honeydew.

üçé Fruits.name: nectarine
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
üçé Fruits.notes: Nectarines are smooth-skinned stone fruits similar to peaches with sweet flavor.

üçé Fruits.name: orange
üçé Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate for extended freshness.
üçé Fruits.notes: Oranges are sweet citrus fruits commonly consumed fresh or as juice.

üçé Fruits.name: papaya
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe; refrigerate afterward.
üçé Fruits.notes: Papayas are tropical fruits with sweet orange flesh and edible seeds.

üçé Fruits.name: peach
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe; refrigerate after ripening.
üçé Fruits.notes: Peaches are juicy stone fruits with fuzzy skin and sweet flesh.

üçé Fruits.name: pear
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
üçé Fruits.notes: Pears are sweet pomes with a soft texture, eaten fresh or cooked.

üçé Fruits.name: pineapple
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate cut pieces.
üçé Fruits.notes: Pineapples are tropical fruits with sweet, tangy flesh often used fresh or cooked.

üçé Fruits.name: plum
üçé Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe; refrigerate after ripening.
üçé Fruits.notes: Plums are sweet stone fruits eaten fresh or dried as prunes.

üçé Fruits.name: pomegranate
üçé Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate after cutting.
üçé Fruits.notes: Pomegranates are red fruits filled with juicy seeds known for their tart flavor.

üçé Fruits.name: raspberries
üçé Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for longer storage.
üçé Fruits.notes: Raspberries are delicate, sweet-tart berries used fresh or in preserves.

üçé Fruits.name: strawberries
üçé Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for longer storage.
üçé Fruits.notes: Strawberries are sweet, bright red berries commonly eaten fresh or in desserts.

üçé Fruits.name: watermelon
üçé Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated after cutting to maintain freshness.
üçé Fruits.notes: Watermelons are large, juicy melons popular in summer with sweet, watery flesh.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: barley
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Barley is a versatile whole grain often used in soups, salads, and side dishes.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: black beans
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried beans in airtight containers in a cool, dry place; refrigerate cooked beans.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Black beans are small, shiny beans popular in Latin American cuisines.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: brown rice
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Brown rice is whole grain rice with the bran layer intact, providing more fiber than white rice.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: buckwheat
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight containers.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Buckwheat is a gluten-free pseudocereal with a strong, nutty flavor.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: bulgur
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Bulgur is cracked wheat that is parboiled and dried, commonly used in Middle Eastern dishes.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: chickpeas
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried chickpeas in airtight containers; refrigerate cooked.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Chickpeas are versatile legumes used in hummus, stews, and salads.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: farro
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight containers.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Farro is an ancient wheat grain with a chewy texture and nutty flavor.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: green lentils
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried lentils in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Green lentils hold their shape well and have a mild, earthy flavor.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: kidney beans
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried beans in airtight containers; refrigerate cooked beans.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Kidney beans are large, reddish beans commonly used in chili and other hearty dishes.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: noodles
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dry noodles in a cool, dry place. Fresh or cooked noodles should be refrigerated and used within a few days.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Noodles are a broad category of dough-based strands or ribbons that vary by region, ingredients, and cooking method. Includes wheat, rice, egg, and mung bean varieties.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: egg noodles
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dry egg noodles in a cool, dry place. Fresh or cooked noodles should be refrigerated and used within a few days.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Egg noodles are made from wheat flour and eggs, offering a richer flavor and yellow color compared to plain pasta. They are common in Asian and European cuisines.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: ramen noodles
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dry ramen in a cool, dry place. Fresh or cooked ramen should be refrigerated and used within a few days.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Ramen noodles are typically made from wheat flour, salt, and an alkaline agent, and are sold in dried or fresh form. Instant ramen includes a seasoning packet and cooks quickly.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: elbow pasta
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dry elbow pasta in a cool, dry place in an airtight container. Cooked pasta should be refrigerated and consumed within a few days.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Elbow pasta, also known as elbow macaroni, is a small, curved tube-shaped pasta commonly used in casseroles, macaroni and cheese, and pasta salads.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: oats
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight containers.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Oats are whole grains commonly used for breakfast cereals and baking.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: panko crumbs
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container. Refrigerate or freeze for longer shelf life.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Panko crumbs are Japanese-style breadcrumbs known for their light, airy, and crispy texture. Ideal for breading and crisp toppings.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: pinto beans
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried beans in airtight containers; refrigerate cooked beans.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Pinto beans are medium-sized beans common in Mexican and Southwestern cuisine.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: quinoa
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Quinoa is a gluten-free pseudograin known for its high protein content and versatility.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: red lentils
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried lentils in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Red lentils cook quickly and tend to break down, making them ideal for soups and purees.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: soybeans
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried soybeans in a cool, dry place; refrigerate cooked soybeans.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Soybeans are versatile legumes used fresh as edamame or processed into tofu and soy milk.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: white rice
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: White rice is polished rice with the bran and germ removed, resulting in a softer texture and longer shelf life.

üåæ Grains & Legumes.name: wild rice
üåæ Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
üåæ Grains & Legumes.notes: Wild rice is an aquatic grass seed with a distinctive nutty flavor and chewy texture.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: butter
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Refrigerate; freeze for long term storage.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Butter is a dairy fat used for cooking, baking, and flavoring.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: unsalted butter
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Store refrigerated. Keep wrapped to prevent absorbing odors.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Unsalted butter contains no added salt, preferred for baking to control sodium content precisely.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: cheddar cheese
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Refrigerate; keep wrapped to avoid drying.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Cheddar is a firm, often sharp cheese used widely in cooking and sandwiches.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: cream cheese
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Cream cheese is a soft, mild cheese often used as a spread or in desserts.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: gouda cheese
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Keep refrigerated. Wrap tightly in wax paper or plastic wrap.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Gouda is a Dutch cheese with a smooth, creamy texture and a mild, nutty flavor. Aged varieties become firmer and more complex.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: havarti cheese
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Keep refrigerated in airtight wrapping. Use within a week once opened.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Havarti is a Danish cheese known for its buttery flavor and creamy, smooth texture. Often used in sandwiches or melted into dishes.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: mozzarella cheese
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Mozzarella is a soft cheese popular for melting on pizzas and salads.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: parmesan cheese
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Store in refrigerator in an airtight container. Use within a few weeks once opened.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Parmesan is a hard, aged Italian cheese known for its sharp, nutty flavor and is commonly grated over pasta, salads, and soups.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: egg
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Eggs are a common cooking and baking ingredient rich in protein.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: goat cheese
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Goat cheese is a soft, tangy cheese used in salads, spreads, and baking.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: half and half
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Half and half is a mixture of milk and cream commonly used in coffee and cooking.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: milk
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Milk is a nutrient-rich liquid dairy product used widely in cooking and beverages.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: sour cream
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Sour cream is a fermented dairy product with a tangy flavor used in cooking and dips.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: whipping cream
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Whipping cream is a high-fat dairy cream used for whipping and enriching dishes.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: heavy whipping cream
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Refrigerate and use within 7 days after opening. Do not freeze.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Heavy whipping cream is a rich dairy product with at least 36% milk fat, used in sauces, soups, desserts, and for making whipped cream.

ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.name: yogurt
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.storage: Refrigerate and consume by expiration date.
ü•õ Dairy & Eggs.notes: Yogurt is a fermented dairy product with probiotic benefits.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: bacon
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate and use by expiration; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Bacon is cured and smoked pork belly, commonly sliced and cooked until crispy.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: beef
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh beef; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Beef is meat from cattle, available in various cuts with rich flavor.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: beef broth
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate after opening; freeze for long-term storage. Shelf-stable when unopened.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Beef broth is a rich, savory liquid made by simmering beef bones and vegetables, commonly used to enhance meat-based dishes.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: chicken
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate raw; freeze for long-term storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Use this when the chicken type isn't specified. For precise recipes, prefer specific cuts like breast or thigh.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: chicken breast
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Chicken breast is a lean cut of poultry widely used in various dishes.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: chuck roast
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Keep refrigerated and use within 3-5 days or freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Chuck roast is a flavorful and economical cut from the shoulder of the cow, ideal for slow cooking methods that tenderize the meat.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: chicken broth
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate after opening; freeze for long-term storage. Shelf-stable when unopened.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Chicken broth is a savory liquid made from simmered chicken and aromatics, often used as a cooking base.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: low sodium chicken broth
aliases: less sodium chicken broth, low-sodium chicken broth
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Unopened shelf-stable broth should be stored in a cool, dry place. Once opened, refrigerate and use within 4‚Äì5 days or freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Low sodium chicken broth has about 40‚Äì50% less salt than regular broth, making it a preferred option for low-sodium diets and recipes where salt levels are controlled manually.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: rich chicken stock
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days, or freeze for long-term storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Rich chicken stock is a deeply concentrated, gelatinous broth made by simmering bones and connective tissue for extended periods, used to impart intense flavor and body to soups, stews, risottos, and pan sauces.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: chicken thigh
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Chicken thigh is a flavorful cut of poultry with more fat than breast.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: ground beef
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Ground beef is minced beef used in burgers, sauces, and more.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: ground pork
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Ground pork is minced pork commonly used in sausages and stir-fries.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: ground turkey
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Ground turkey is lean ground poultry used as a lower-fat substitute for beef.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: ham
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Ham is cured pork, available sliced or whole, often smoked or cooked.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: lamb
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Lamb is meat from young sheep, tender and flavorful.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: pork chop
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Pork chops are cuts from the loin of the pig, tender and lean.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: pork shoulder
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Pork shoulder is a fatty, flavorful cut ideal for slow cooking and pulled pork.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: salmon
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Salmon is a popular fatty fish prized for its flavor and omega-3s.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: sausage
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate and use quickly; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Sausage is ground meat mixed with spices, typically formed into links or bulk.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: shrimp
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Shrimp are small shellfish enjoyed in a variety of cuisines.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: steak
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Steak is a thick cut of beef known for tenderness and flavor.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: stewing beef
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze. Use within 2‚Äì3 days if fresh.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Stewing beef is pre-cut chunks of beef suitable for slow cooking methods like stewing or braising.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: tilapia
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Tilapia is a mild-flavored freshwater fish widely farmed for food.

üçñ Meat & Seafood.name: tuna
üçñ Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
üçñ Meat & Seafood.notes: Tuna is a firm, meaty fish popular grilled or canned.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: basil
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store at room temp in a glass of water or loosely in fridge.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Fresh basil is a fragrant leafy herb essential to Italian and Southeast Asian cooking, especially pesto and salads.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: dried basil
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in a sealed jar away from light and heat.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dried basil is milder than fresh and used in soups, sauces, and marinades where long cooking is needed.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: black pepper
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Keep peppercorns or ground pepper in an airtight container in a cool, dry place.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Black pepper is the most common spice worldwide, used to add heat and flavor.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: cayenne pepper
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cayenne pepper adds strong heat and vibrant color to dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: chili powder
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Chili powder is a blend of spices used for a smoky, spicy flavor.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: cilantro
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Keep stems in water covered loosely with a bag, or wrap in damp paper towel and refrigerate.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cilantro has a bright, citrusy flavor; commonly used fresh in Mexican, Indian, and Asian cuisines.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: cinnamon
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cinnamon is a warm, sweet spice used in baking and savory dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: cloves
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store whole or ground cloves in airtight container away from light and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cloves have a strong, aromatic flavor used in baking and cooking.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: coriander
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Coriander seeds have a warm, citrusy flavor used in many spice blends.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: cumin
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cumin is a strong, earthy spice essential in many cuisines worldwide.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: dill
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store dried dill in airtight container away from light and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dill has a fresh, slightly tangy flavor used in pickling and salads.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: fennel seed
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store fennel seeds in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Fennel seeds have a sweet, licorice-like flavor used in cooking and baking.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: garlic powder
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from moisture and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Garlic powder is a convenient alternative to fresh garlic with concentrated flavor.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: ginger
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store ground ginger in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Ginger adds a warm, spicy flavor to both sweet and savory dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: johnny's seasoning salt
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from light and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Johnny's Seasoning Salt is a proprietary blend of salt, spices, paprika, garlic, and sugar. It‚Äôs commonly used to season meats, vegetables, and fries.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: mint
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in water like flowers or loosely wrapped in fridge.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Mint is a fragrant, cooling herb used in savory dishes, teas, cocktails, and desserts.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: dried mint
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dried mint has a sharp, cooling aroma and is often used in teas, marinades, or Middle Eastern dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: nutmeg
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Nutmeg is a warm, aromatic spice used in baking and savory dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: onion powder
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in an airtight container in a cool, dark place. Avoid moisture exposure.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Onion powder is a potent dried spice used to add onion flavor quickly without chopping. Great for dry rubs and seasoning blends.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: onion soup mix
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store sealed in a cool, dry place; keep packets airtight after opening.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Typical packet is ~1 oz (28 g), about 3 tablespoons of mix.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: oregano
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Wrap in damp towel or store in water in fridge.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Fresh oregano has a pungent, peppery flavor used in Greek, Mexican, and Mediterranean cooking.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: dried oregano
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in sealed container in cool, dry area.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dried oregano is potent and earthy, a staple in Italian and Mexican dried herb blends.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: paprika
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Paprika is a mild spice made from ground peppers, often smoked.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: parsley
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Wrap in damp paper towel or place upright in water in fridge.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Assumes ~1 bunch ‚âà 60 g and ‚âà 1 cup (240 mL) when chopped.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: dried parsley
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Keep in airtight jar in a cool, dark place.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dried parsley has a subtler flavor and is mostly used for visual appeal or light seasoning.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: red pepper flakes
aliases: crushed red pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, red-pepper flakes
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Red pepper flakes add heat and texture to dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: rosemary
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Refrigerate wrapped in a damp paper towel or upright in water.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Fresh rosemary is a woody herb with pine-like aroma, often used in roasts, marinades, and stews.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: dried rosemary
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container in a cool, dark place.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dried rosemary has a concentrated, piney flavor used in smaller amounts than fresh, ideal for long-cooking dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: sage
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store dried sage in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Sage has a strong, earthy flavor used in savory dishes.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: salt
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in a dry place.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Salt is a universal seasoning essential in cooking.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: sea salt
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container to prevent clumping.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Sea salt is produced by evaporating seawater and retains trace minerals that can slightly affect flavor and color. It comes in coarse, fine, and flaked varieties.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: sesame seeds
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in an airtight container in a cool, dark place. Refrigerate or freeze for longer shelf life.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Sesame seeds have a subtle nutty flavor and are used in a wide variety of cuisines. Toasting intensifies flavor. Black sesame has a bolder taste.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: thyme
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Refrigerate wrapped in a damp towel or upright in water.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Thyme is a woody herb with savory notes, commonly used in soups, stews, and roasted meats.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: dried thyme
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Keep tightly sealed away from light and moisture.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dried thyme is earthy and bold, ideal for long-simmered dishes and dry rubs.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: turmeric
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Turmeric is a bright yellow spice with a warm, earthy flavor and health benefits.

üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.name: vanilla extract
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
üßÇ Seasonings & Spices.notes: Vanilla extract is a common flavoring used in baking and desserts.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: baking powder
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Baking powder is a chemical leavening agent used in baked goods to create rise.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: baking soda
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from moisture.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Baking soda is a pure chemical leavening agent used with acids in recipes.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: brown sugar
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in airtight container to prevent drying out.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Brown sugar contains molasses giving it moisture and a richer flavor than white sugar.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: cornstarch
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Cornstarch is a fine powder used as a thickener in cooking and baking.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: flour
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight container to prevent bugs and moisture.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Flour is the primary base for most baked goods and thickening.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: all-purpose flour
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate or freeze for longer shelf life.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: All-purpose flour is a versatile wheat flour suitable for most baking and cooking needs. It has a moderate protein content and is commonly used in recipes ranging from cakes to breads.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: honey
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a sealed container at room temperature. Crystallization is natural.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Honey is a natural sweetener with floral flavors and preservative qualities.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: molasses
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from light.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Molasses is a thick, dark syrup byproduct of sugar refining with a robust flavor.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: powdered sugar
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in airtight container to prevent clumping.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Powdered sugar is finely ground sugar with a bit of cornstarch added to prevent clumping.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: sugar
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in airtight container to prevent clumping and contamination.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Sugar is a basic sweetener essential for baking and cooking.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: vanilla extract
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in cool, dark place away from heat.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Vanilla extract is a popular flavoring used in baking and desserts.

üçû Baking Ingredients.name: yeast
üçû Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in refrigerator or freezer to maintain potency.
üçû Baking Ingredients.notes: Yeast is a living leavening agent used for bread and other fermented doughs.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: apple cider vinegar
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place away from heat.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Apple cider vinegar is a popular vinegar with a fruity, tangy flavor.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: avocado oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place. Keep sealed tightly. Refrigeration not necessary but may prolong shelf life.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Avocado oil has a high smoke point (~520¬∞F for refined) and a neutral to slightly buttery flavor. Ideal for high-heat cooking.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: balsamic vinegar
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Balsamic vinegar is a dark, sweet vinegar often used in dressings and reductions.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: canola oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place away from heat and light.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Canola oil is a neutral-flavored oil with a high smoke point.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: coconut oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; solidifies below 76¬∞F (24¬∞C).
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Coconut oil is a tropical oil with a distinctive flavor and solid at room temperature.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: neutral oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place. Use within a few months of opening.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Neutral oils are used when minimal flavor is desired. Common types include canola, vegetable, and grapeseed oil.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: olive oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place. Reseal tightly after use to preserve freshness.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Regular olive oil is refined and blended for a neutral flavor and higher smoke point, making it better for high-heat cooking compared to extra virgin olive oil.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: extra virgin olive oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place. Keep tightly sealed to prevent oxidation.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Extra virgin olive oil is the highest-quality olive oil, made from pure, cold-pressed olives. It has a strong, peppery flavor and is ideal for raw use and finishing dishes.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: rice vinegar
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Rice vinegar is a mild vinegar commonly used in Asian cuisine.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: sesame oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place, refrigerate after opening.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Sesame oil is prized for its rich, nutty flavor and aroma, especially toasted varieties.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: vegetable oil
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Vegetable oil is a neutral-flavored oil used in many cooking applications.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: white vinegar
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: White vinegar is a clear, sharp vinegar commonly used in cooking and cleaning.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: barbeque sauce
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Barbecue sauce is a flavorful sauce often used for grilling and dipping.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: hot sauce
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in refrigerator after opening.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Hot sauce adds heat and flavor to dishes.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: jam
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
ü´í Oils & Vinegars.notes: Jam is a sweet fruit spread made by cooking fruit with sugar.

ü´í Oils & Vinegars.name: dijon mustard
